channel.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Sat, 16 Nov 2024 04:57:08 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Elon Musk reacts to major advertisers returning to X after boycott: 'We super appreciate...'
item.description: Elon Musk and CEO Linda Yaccarino are being lauded as major brands like IBM and Disney return to advertising on X after a nearly year-long hiatus. This follows reports of a significant drop in ad revenue attributed to concerns about brand safety under Musk's leadership.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump appoints former campaign official Steven Cheung as White House communications director
item.description: Donald Trump has appointed Steven Cheung, his former campaign spokesman, as White House communications director. Sergio Gor will lead the Presidential Personnel Office. North Dakota Governor Doug Burgum, who briefly challenged Trump for the 2024 GOP nomination, will be heading the Department of the Interior.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: King Charles can't have 'unilateral' talks with Prince Harry if Prince William is 'not' in agreement: Royal author
item.description: Royal biographer Robert Hardman emphasizes that King Charles III must involve both Prince William and Prince Harry in any decisions regarding their fractured relationship. Hardman highlights the importance of a "three-way process" for reconciliation, emphasizing the significance of Prince William's agreement due to potential impacts on his inheritance and public perception.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Matt Gaetz's sexual misconduct report will remain secret? House Speaker says 'terrible precedent' if published
item.description: “I’m going to strongly request that the Ethics Committee not issue the report because that is not the way we do things in the House, and I think that would be a terrible precedent to set,” Speaker of the House Mike Johnson told reporters Friday. On Thursday, he was at Mar-a-Lago with Donald Trump and the nudge apparently came from there.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Diddy's celebrity friends 'scared to death' of testifying against him in court
item.description: Sean 'Diddy' Combs remains in jail on charges of sex trafficking and racketeering, which he denies. His celebrity friends have been noticeably silent since his arrest, causing speculation that they are afraid to be associated with the case. A PR expert suggests they fear damaging their brands and being subpoenaed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: After son, Elon Musk now carries daughter Azure at Mar-A-Lago; Trump says, 'I can't get him out of here'
item.description: Elon Musk shared a photo of Argentina president Javier Milei who became the first foreign leader to visit Donald Trump after his election win. In the photo, Musk was seen carrying his four-year-old daughter Azure. Milei shared the photo and wrote, "Argentina is playing in a different league today... An unprecedented scenario. We will have to take advantage of it."
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Canada's hunger crisis: 3.49 million visited food banks in Toronto in one year, says report
item.description: Toronto's food banks are facing an unprecedented crisis, with over 3.5 million visits in the past year – exceeding the city's entire population. The report highlights the dire situation of food bank users who are left with a meager $7.78 per day for food and essentials after paying for housing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Poor job prospects, riots putting off Indian students from studying in UK
item.description: The number of Indian students choosing British universities has plummeted by 20%, raising concerns about the financial stability of the UK higher education sector. Factors like the UK's economic climate, recent riots, and visa restrictions are pushing Indian students towards alternative destinations like Germany, Ireland, and the US.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: Who is Eduardo Tamayo, Tulsi Gabbard's ex-husband?
item.description: Tulsi Gabbard retained Tamayo surname years after her divorce and said she did it hoping that she and Eduardo Tamayo might still have a future together. They were divorced in 2006 and in 2011, Tulsi Gabbard announced that she was changing her name from Tulsi Gabbard Tamayo to Tulsi Gabbard. In 2015, Tulsi Gabbard got married to Abraham Williams. The couple does not have any children.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: No. 10 apologises for serving meat and alcohol at Diwali party
item.description: Downing Street has issued an apology for serving meat and alcohol at a Diwali reception held two weeks ago. The event, intended to celebrate the contributions of the British Hindu, Sikh, and Jain communities, sparked criticism for the oversight, with some deeming it culturally insensitive.
item.dc:creator: NAOMI CANTON

item.title: Trial begins for illegal immigrant Jose Ibarra in murder of nursing student Laken Riley
item.description: The trial of Jose Ibarra, a Venezuelan national charged with the murder of Laken Riley, a 22-year-old nursing student, commenced in a Georgia courtroom. Ibarra, who entered the US illegally, opted for a bench trial. Prosecutors presented evidence linking him to the crime, including DNA and cellphone data.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Severe turbulence hits Miami-bound Scandinavian Airlines flight: '...feet touching ceiling'
item.description: A Scandinavian Airlines flight en route to Miami from Stockholm experienced severe turbulence over Greenland, forcing the flight to return to Europe. Terrifying footage circulating online shows passengers screaming as the plane rapidly descended, tossing belongings and passengers into the air. While there were no serious injuries, the airline confirmed the aircraft required a thorough inspection.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Delhi to San Francisco in less than an hour? Elon Musk says it's 'possible' through Starship
item.description: Elon Musk's SpaceX envisions revolutionizing travel with its Starship, aiming to transport passengers between global cities in under an hour. The spacecraft would travel 'parallel' to Earth's surface, potentially enabling journeys from New York to Shanghai in 39 minutes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Matt Gaetz still under investigation? When his sister-in-law called him a pedophile
item.description: The sex-trafficking investigation into Matt Gaetz began before he married his girlfriend Ginger Luckey. Gaetz's to-be sister-in-law released videos calling him a pedophile and saying that she was not surprised that Gaetz was being probed. Gaetz's wife defended Gaetz and said her sister had a history of destructive behavior. With Gatez possibly becoming the attorney general, he is not under any investigation now.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pentagon in turmoil: Trump reportedly plans to fire senior military leaders who prioritized DEI
item.description: Incoming President Donald Trump's transition team is reportedly compiling a list of senior military officers who prioritized diversity initiatives over combat readiness. Sources claim an executive order is being drafted to establish a panel for recommending the removal of these officers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Missouri teacher charged with offering marijuana for sex with students: 'F***ked up'
item.description: Carissa Jane Smith, a 30-year-old former substitute teacher from Missouri, is facing serious charges including statutory rape, sodomy, and sexual trafficking. Smith is accused of engaging in sexual acts with multiple students in exchange for money, alcohol, and marijuana.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Pete Hegseth hit a man with an ax on live TV. Video goes viral
item.description: ​Hegseth, an Army National Guard officer, participated in an ax-throwing contest against Clayton Morris on Fox and Friends. Hegseth hitting a man was not intentional but despite his military training, he could not throw the ax on the target and instead hit a drummer standing on the road. Hegseth was later sued over the incident.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel makes fun of RFK Jr: 'Who better than guy whose brain eaten by worm'
item.description: “This tells you all you need to know about our country right now: RFK got caught having phone sex with a reporter and she was fired,” Kimmel continued. “What happened to him? They made him secretary of health and human services. Why not? I mean, if Matt Gaetz is going to be attorney general, bring in Gary Busey to run the CIA. Go for broke!” Kimmel said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Democrats think this is Swastika': Row over chest tattoo of Trump's secretary of defense Pete Hegseth
item.description: Pete Hegseth's chest tattoo, a Jerusalem cross, sparked controversy on social media with some calling it Nazi Swastika. The tattoo previously caused Hegseth to be deemed an extremist and barred from guarding President Biden's inauguration. “And my orders were revoked to guard the Biden inauguration. Jerusalem cross tattoo, it’s just a Christian symbol ... [that] is what got me disinvited," Hegseth said earlier.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sylvester Stallone calls Donald Trump 'second George Washington': 'I mean it'
item.description: “And I'll just say this, and I mean it: When George Washington defended his country, he had no idea that he was going to change the world. ’cause without him, you could imagine what the world would look like. Guess what? We got the second George Washington,” Sylvester Stallone who never identified as a Republican and did not endorse Donald Trump said about Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
